file_content.text: I misjudged you, Lieutenant. You are the truest sort of hero. Thank you.
Oh, Markus... please, no....
How... how could you do this to us? How could you be so wretched?
Oh, Markus... it's so wonderful to see you again.
I demand that you take me to my husband at once!
Must we go this way?
Stay to our course, thug. I have no interest in conversing with you.
How have I come to these straits? How?
Are you trying to get us killed, cretin?
A lifetime of nobility, and this is how it ends.
I'll soon be nothing but a scorched and mangled corpse, not even fit to be buried.
Fool--you've dragged me to my death.
You truly don't care if we die, do you?
I would have liked to have seen Markus again, one last time.
Stay back! Who are you? What do you want from us?
Is this what real Organa soldiers look like, mum? How fierce!
Stay behind me, daughter! I won't let you be taken from me!
We won't hurt you.
Remain calm.
I'm not here to hurt you.
Remain calm.
You charge into our home, weapons drawn and expect us to believe that you mean no harm?
We aren't that frightening, are we?
Are we that scary?
We'd better be. Intimidation, striking fear into the enemy--this ringing any bells?
Certainly, Lieutenant. Military guidebooks on public interactions emphasize the intimidating effect soldiers can have on civilians.
It's only right that that the enemies of freedom and liberty should fear us, Lieutenant. We aggressively defend what they seek to destroy!
I didn't realize I was so frightening.
Am I that scary?
Yes! You're positively dreadful!
Don't make me hurt you.
Why have you come here? What are you going to do to us?
Your husband wanted me to get you out of here--he even gave me the password, "Tyrovan".
Markus sent me.
Your worthless husband won't talk until you're safe. But he gave me a password--"Tyrovan".
I'm being forced to help you.
Tyrovan... the code word. Markus... he's still alive.
"Tyrovan". There--now put on these cloaks and keep your mouths shut.
Shut up.
How dare y--Tyrovan? Markus... he must still be alive.
We have to go to him, mum, we have to!
But... but how will we make the journey? We'll be spotted traveling with this soldier--marked as traitors to House Thul, to the Empire!
I--I want to see your father again as much as you do, dearest... but we must think these things through.
Put these on, so no one will recognize you.
That's why I brought cloaks.
Wear these cloaks. They should hide your identities.
I already thought it through.
Here--I have cloaks with hoods to hide your ugly faces. Problem solved.
Whine, whine, whine.
Well, I... I suppose, if we have no other choice.
I'll keep you safe, ma'am. You have my word.
Don't worry.
Just think of it as an unusually dangerous vacation.
This will be fun!
Very reassuring.
We're going to go now. So this would be a good time to shut up.
Nope, no other choice.
Don't mope, mum--this is going to be so exciting! Let's go!
That's why we have these cloaks, mum! Come, let's put them on.
You see, daughter? This is the sort of brutish thug in whom you would entrust our lives.
We clearly have no other option. Now come, let's try these cloaks on.
There, now, you see? No one will ever recognize us.
Perfect! These will work splendidly. Come, mum, let's see how they look.
I do not appreciate strangers barging into my home.
